decks.notes: The main focus of this Mono Black Control deck is to disrupt your opponent's game plan by utilizing removal spells like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat, as well as hand disruption like Thoughtseize and Duress. The deck also includes powerful planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil to control the board and provide card advantage. The addition of Aclazotz, Deepest Betrayal and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse adds a strong finisher to close out the game. The deck aims to control the game until it can land a devastating blow with its threats.

Utilize efficient removal spells and disruptive hand attacks to control the board and disrupt your opponent's game plan. Develop a strong board presence with evasive creatures that can quickly apply pressure and close out the game. Stay proactive and maintain tempo while utilizing versatile threats to keep the opponent on the back foot. Punish slower decks with aggressive creature plays and protect your key threats with countermagic when necessary. Focus on consistently applying pressure and efficiently utilizing your resources to outpace and overwhelm your opponent.

The deck focuses on quickly casting spells to bring back Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard, utilizing cheap instants and sorceries to trigger its ability. The key strategy is to fill the graveyard with spells, while also controlling the board with removal and countermagic. The deck aims to pressure the opponent with the recurring threat of Arclight Phoenix and tempo plays, ultimately overwhelming them with card advantage and powerful spells. It combines aggressive creatures with disruptive spells to maintain pressure and control the game.

The main concept of this UW Control deck is to use a large number of control spells and removal options to outlast and outplay opponents. By utilizing cards like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria, Supreme Verdict, and Dovin's Veto, along with a versatile sideboard option in Yorion, Sky Nomad, the deck aims to control the board and disrupt opponent's strategies. Additionally, the deck includes card draw options like Memory Deluge and a variety of land options to ensure mana consistency. Overall, the focus is on controlling the game and overwhelming opponents with powerful control elements.
